articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean people's struggle expressed 
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Oscar Figuera, general secretary of the central committee of the Communist Party of Venezuela, expressed solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle at the 11th party congress held from March 8 to 10.
 He in a report expressed firm solidarity with the Korean people who, under the correct guidance of leader Kim Jong Il and the Workers' Party of Korea, have made achievements in the struggle for national reunification and socialist construction, despite the unabated anti-DPRK moves of the imperialists.

articles.title: Projected U.S.-S. Korea military exercises under fire
articles.content:
Indian Communist Party flails Bush for his reckless remarks 
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The political bureau of the central committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) issued a statement on March 9, condemning U.S. President Bush's hostile policy towards the DPRK.
 The statement said that Bush imprudently termed the DPRK and other countries part of an "axis of evil" in a bid to hold world supremacy and is attempting to expand the "anti-terrorism war" to Korea.    
 The U.S. imperialists are keeping the artificial division of the Korean peninsula despite the growing demand for national reunification on the Korean Peninsula, the statement said, adding: The U.S. troops' presence in South Korea is a major obstacle to peace and reunification process of the Korean Peninsula.
